title: Coleen Rooney slammed for ‘causing pregnant Rebekah Vardy stress’ amid feud
text:
After just one Instagram post, WAGatha Christie was trending on Twitter, with memes taking over social media.

And Nicola McLean has now waded into the whole thing, slating Wayne Rooney’s wife for publicly calling the 37-year-old out while pregnant.

During an appearance on This Morning, she told Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford: ‘Forget who it is, stress can cause so much upset [when pregnant]. It can affect the baby’s brain. You shouldn’t be this stressed out when you’re pregnant.

‘And Coleen Rooney is a mother, she should know that this is not acceptable. Come out now and say, “Until Rebekah is proven guilty, let’s leave this now, this is not okay.”

‘This could have waited. It’s being on for how many years, let it wait, be respectful.’

Nicola also claimed that Coleen, 33, was aware of the can of worms she would be opening when calling Rebekah out on Instagram, and should have gone about things in a different way.

Nicola McLean hit out at Coleen Rooney (Picture: ITV)

‘She could’ve stopped it, she didn’t need to do this,’ she fumed. ‘I don’t know Coleen and I’m not saying Coleen’s a bad person, I don’t know her.

‘I’m saying, as a mother and as someone that’s been in this industry for a long time, you are aware, with her level of following, this is what’s going to happen. She knew that and she chose to put a pregnant woman under this much stress.’

Speaking about the vile trolling her pal has been subjected to, she added: ‘We’ve had two reality TV stars die. We’ve got a pregnant woman that should not be subjected to this level of abuse.

‘It’s horrific. [She’s been told] “Hope the unborn baby dies, hope they both die”. This level of abuse is horrific especially if you’re pregnant.

Coleen Rooney lashed out at Rebekah Vardy on Instagram (Picture: Getty)

‘We all have to have compassion. We’ve got someone who is seven months pregnant who is receiving death threats and saying they wish her unborn baby dies.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The drama all kicked off when Coleen shared a statement on Wednesday reading: ‘For a few years now someone I trusted to follow me on my personal Instagram account has been consistently informing The Sun newspaper of my private posts and stories.

‘There has been so much information given to them about me, my friends and my family – all without my permission or knowledge. After a long time of trying to figure out who it could be, for various reasons, I had a suspicion.

‘To try and prove this, I came up with an idea. I blocked everyone from viewing my Instagram stories except ONE account. (Those on my private account must have been wondering why I haven’t had stories on there for a while.)

Rebekah has denied all the claims (Picture: Rex)

‘Over the past five months I have posted a series of false stories if they made their way into the Sun newspaper. And you know what, they did! The story about gender selection in Mexico, the story about returning to TV and then the latest story about the basement flooding in my new house.

‘It’s been tough keeping it to myself and not making any comment at all, especially when the stories have been leaked, however I had to. Now I know for certain which account/individual it’s come from.

‘I have saved and screenshotted all the original stories which clearly show just one person has viewed them. It’s…… Rebekah Vardy’s account.’

Advertisement

Rebekah – who is currently pregnant with her fifth child – hit back shortly after, denying all the claims and insisting she would be looking into who else had access to her Instagram page.

She also compared arguing with the mum-of-four to ‘rowing with a pigeon’, stating she ‘completely annihilated’ her.

This Morning continues on weekdays, at 10.30am, on ITV.
